oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Woman with war bonds and TNT
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Embracing Citizenship
Military Service
War bonds and funds; Women; TNT (Chemical)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A young woman sits on boxes of TNT with war bonds.

The Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant was built between 1941 and 1943 to produce TNT. It remained in operation until 1945, and was reactivated for the Korean Conflict and the Vietnam War. This image was likely a publicity shot showing a young woman with TNT and war bonds.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant Photographs, 194- to 197-, Jeffrey W. Cash, Collector, Chattanooga Public Library
